text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we see the first signs of early people. These signs show they lived together. For example, we see paintings in caves. Nobody knows the link between this and language. People's brains did not get bigger suddenly. But people's lives were not simple anymore and they became smarter. Did using language make their brains grow and change? Or did their smarter brains start to make language?
